title: Nissan car sales in Europe 2003 to 2018
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Number of units sold, with a total of 16 data points. The chart has 5 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely positive which exists from 2011 to 2007.
Additionally, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2007 to 2003.
Differently, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2016 to 2013.
Similarly, the next significant trend is slightly positive which exists from 2018 to 2016.
Additionally, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2013 to 2011.
gold: This statistic shows the number of cars sold by Nissan in Europe between 2003 and 2018 . European sales of the Nissan cars rose from 400 thousand units sold in 2003 to over 560 thousand units sold by 2017 . In 2018 , there were 487 thousand units of Nissan cars sold in Europe .
